div.l: Myn herte is broken helpe I nam but dede
Ther lith oon vpon̄ my wombe ⁊and on myn hede
Helpe symkyn for the false cherles fiȝt
This Iohn start vp as fast as euer he miȝt
And grasped by the walles to and fro
To fynde a staf and she stert vp also
And knew the esteres bet than did this Iohn
And by the wall a staaf she fond anon̄
And sauȝ a litill shymeryng of a liȝt
For at an hole it shon̄ the mone briȝt
And by that liȝt she sauȝ hem bothe ij
But sikerly she nist who was who
But as she sauȝ a white thing in her ye
And whan she gan this white thing aspie
She wend the clerc had wered a voliper
And with the staaf she drouȝ ay ner and ner
And wend haue it hitithit this Aleyn at fulle
And smote the Miller on the piled sculle
That doun̄ he goth and cried harrow I dye
This clerkes bet him wel and let him lye
And greicchen̄ hem and toke her hors anon̄
And eke here mele and on her wey thei gon̄
And at the mille yet thei toke hir cake
Of half a busshel flour ful wel I bake
Thus is the proud meller wel I bete
And hath lost the grynding of the whete
And paied for the souper eueridell
Of Aleyn and of Iohn that bet him well
His wyf is swyued and his douȝter als
Loo such it is A meller to be false
And therfor this ꝓprouerbe is said ful soth
Him dar not wene wel that euil doth
A gilour shal him self begiled be
And god that sitteth hy in mageste
